body.p: On the Ansible node, retrieve the latest version of the playbooks using Git.
Change to the directory that you just cloned:
body.note: All subsequent file names are relative to the ops directory. For example vm_hosts is located in ~/Docker-Synergy/ops and group_vars/vars corresponds to ~/Docker-Synergy/ops/groups_vars/vars.
body.p: You now need to prepare the configuration to match your own environment, prior to deploying Docker EE and the rest of the nodes. To do so, you will need to modify a number of files including:

ul.li: site.yml, the main entry point for the playbooks.

body.p: You also need to create and populate a number of files:

ul.li: group_vars/vault, containing sensitive information that needs to be protected.

body.p: For the latter group, a set of sample files has been provided to help you get started:

ul.li: group_vars/vars.sample, a sample group variables file.
group_vars/backup.sample, a sample backup configuration file.

body.p: The file group_vars/win_worker.yml supports advanced configuration of Windows remote management and in general should not require modification.
You should work from the root account for the configuration steps and also later on when you run the playbooks.
